alert.note: Alert for Coconino Plateau; Western Mogollon Rim; Yavapai County Mountains; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 02 at 12:26PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Highway 89 between Ash Fork and Paulden through 100 PM MST... At 1225 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southeast of Ash Fork, or 22 miles north of Chino Valley, moving west at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of Coconino and Yavapai Counties. This includes State Route 89 between mile markers 342 and 361. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Coconino Plateau; Western Mogollon Rim; Yavapai County Mountains; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins
